parameters: school sized
Mako sat up on a desk and put her hands behind her
back.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Mako> Looks like we're in quite the pickle.
<Teizoku> Some might say this situation happened
because of not two people, but one person.
<Mako> It wasn't me who snuck up on the roof.
<Teizoku> But it was you who submitted my photos to
the competition.
josei_04a[BUST]
Mako raised up her hands gesturing it can’t be helped.
<Mako> Well duh, you would never do it otherwise.
You’ve always been too grass-chewing for your own good.
Mako kicked up her feet on the desk.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Mako> That’s why you need a little bit of a push,
you want to be a photographer in the future? Then
you gotta git it to git going.
josei_02b[BUST]
<Mako> Cattle have to be poked sometimes you know?
Eat some greener grass on the other field.
<Teizoku> I’m not a cow Mako, and aren’t you worried?
This might be a disaster if I can’t take a good shot.
josei_04a[BUST]
<Mako> Because you always take good shots Teizoku,
I’ve been around you long enough to never have been
disappointed.
<Teizoku> But those are my shots, those shots aren’t
supposed to be for some magazine or some school
competition.
<Mako> Now this is the cattle prod, you can’t build a
career off of piling a private collection of pretty
pictures. You have to market and make a name for
yourself, build the brand of you.
josei_01b[BUST]
<Mako> Plus it will also boost my leverage with the
Principal, so it is a win-win-win situation for all
three of us, don’t you think?
Teizoku remained silent, thinking.
<Teizoku> Let’s get this done as quickly as possible.
josei_04a[BUST]
Mako nodded her head.
josei_04b[BUST]
<Mako> Yes!
<Teizoku> What are we doing?
Mako started to slowly pace around the room.
<Mako> The Principal said the photography topic is
local areas, but it's more specific than that. We
need you to take a picture of a maid cafe, it's the
only area that we don’t have a good picture of.
<Teizoku> Okay.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Mako> And from my research, there is one maid cafe in
the area that has never been photographed before
due to their strict no-picture policy. You will go in
there and get a fantastic shot of one of their maids.
Teizoku looked concerned.
<Teizoku> How am I supposed to do that if they have a
no-picture policy?
Mako stopped pacing.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Mako> Really Tei-kun? You’re gonna be like this?
<Teizoku> There’s gotta be some other way, we
shouldn’t violate people’s privacy like this.
josei_02b[BUST]
<Mako> What can the cafe do? They can’t sue our
school, the worst they can do is ban you from the cafe.
<Mako> I double-checked with the law teacher already,
we are clear. Just take it and don’t think about it
too much.
<Mako> Plus, this will all be over very quickly, and
you can get back to your normal life. One shot and
done.
<Mako> The maids also won’t care if they don’t know.
What they are unaware of they don’t care of, you know?
<Teizoku> Sigh...
Teizoku thought for a moment.
<Teizoku> What if I got a maid’s consent by becoming
her friend?
<Mako> So long as I get the photo, I don’t mind the
specifics. Just get her photo, become her friend or
don’t and take it sneakily, as long as the photo
is taken.
<Teizoku> It’s very important for me that the subject
has trust while participating in the photography.
<Mako> Good for you Tei-kun, that becomes your own
problem.
<Teizoku> No Mako, it is your problem also. You will
help me if I struggle to befriend them and get their
approval for the photo.
<Teizoku> You have a network and influence in this
school, this is out of my comfort zone so I’m going
to need help. You put me into this damn situation,
you have to see it all the way through.
josei_04a[BUST]
<Mako> These are your own extra requirements, but I
don’t mind helping you. It’s just talking to a girl
our age, what can be so hard?
<Teizoku> Well this isn’t a spare hobby of mine, I’m
sure problems will come up.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Mako> If you cannot take her picture with her consent
by the deadline, then you have to take it by all means
necessary, without her consent if need be.
<Mako> This situation is not just about you remember,
don’t be selfish. My reputation, the Principal’s
reputation, and the School’s reputation all are riding
the line here.
<Teizoku> ...Alright
<Mako> Here is the location of the cafe I suggest you
start as soon as possible, the competition is in 2
weeks. Try to scope it out first and then we can meet
and talk if you need something.
<Teizoku> I will go there after school today and check
it out.
A

josei_03b[BUST]
school sized
<Mako> Wow you’re such a virgin Tei-kun.
Inside of an empty classroom, Teizoku and Mako are
sitting down and discussing the day.
josei_03a[BUST]
<Teizoku> I told you I’m not good with this sort of
thing!
Mako has her face scrunched up resting on her palm.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Mako> You are hopeless, at this rate you will either
say something too embarrassing and ruin the encounter
or she will have you in the palm of her hand like this.
Mako snapped her finger.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Teizoku> Ahhhhh, this is not good.
Teizoku started to pace around the classroom
frantically.
<Mako> You know Tei-kun
<Teizoku> Yeah?
<Mako> You could just wait until she’s busy pouring a
drink, and quickly take a stealth shot while
she’s distracted.
josei_04a[BUST]
<Mako> It will save both you and me a lot of time.
<Teizoku> No! I won’t do that, I have dignity as a
photographer.
<Teizoku> But I am definitely not close enough with her
yet to get her ‘yes’ to getting photographed,
especially since it’s going behind the back of
the cafe.
josei_01a[BUST]
Mako looked at Teizoku.
josei_02b[BUST]
<Mako> Don’t you ever forget, this is for the good of
the school, my reputation, and your future career as
well. A lot is on the line with this competition,
don’t make a mess out of it.
<Mako> There is so much we will all gain once you
take the picture, and losing the competition is
unthinkable. Stay focused.
<Teizoku> Yeah, yeah.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Teizoku> Oh yeah.
Teizoku stopped pacing.
<Teizoku> There’s a 1800 fee per visit, you should
cover the cost.
josei_04a[BUST]
<Mako> The cost is covered already in the future
installment of your rooftop-garden clemency.
<Teizoku> Geh.
<Teizoku> Anyways Mako, help me think here.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Mako> Did you notice anything unique about her?
<Teizoku> Well, she was the only maid to wear a mask
and sunglasses. Wait, she didn’t wear sunglasses. She
said she was wearing glasses that got tinted black due
to something.
josei_03b[BUST]
<Mako> Can’t she not see?
<Teizoku> I didn’t ask, I don’t know if she likes it
like that.
<Mako> ...
<Teizoku> Maybe I could give her something to clean
it off.
Mako shrugged her shoulders
josei_01a[BUST]
<Mako> If you want to try cleaning her glasses off,
our chemistry teacher should have something for you.
Just go ask him for it on class 2B.
<Teizoku> Alright Mako, I’m going to try that.
I’m going now.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Mako> Good luck, don’t have too much fun at the cafe,
we are all counting on you.
Teizoku left the room.

school sized
josei_01a[BUST]
<Teizoku> (Yako mentioned she liked the Shibuya brew
shop that’s closed down.)
<Teizoku> (Does Mako know about it?)
<Teizoku> Mako, have you ever heard of the Shibuya
brew shop?
josei_01c[BUST]
<Mako> What was that? Yeah, I’ve heard of it before.
Legendary shop before it was shut down.
josei_04e[BUST]
<Teizoku> Are their recipes online?
josei_03f[BUST]
<Mako> No, I don’t think they put it online or sold it.
It was the owner’s secret.
<Teizoku> Then I want to find a way to contact the
owner.
<Mako> Hah, good luck. The owner has been MIA for
several years from the public eye, and the shut-down
itself was wrapped in drama. Finding him would be a
difficult request. Although...
Mako started stroking her chin
josei_01c[BUST]
<Mako> There were rumours earlier this year that a
hobo who looked like the owner was spotted in the
slum town behind Shinjuku. There’s no official report,
just an urban whisper on 2chan.
josei_02b[BUST]
josei_01e[BUST]
<Teizoku> How do you get to the slum town and what
does he look like?
<Mako> You seriously want to find him? Look it up
yourself online, those two things aren’t secrets and
I have better things to do. His name is Shibuya Jin.
<Teizoku> Alright, thanks Mako.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Teizoku> Also Mako...
josei_02e[BUST]
Teizoku hesitated for a moment before speaking.
<Teizoku> Why are we doing this competition?
Mako blinked once.
josei_02b[BUST]
<Mako> Whaddaya mean? It’s for your future, my future,
and the school’s reputation of course.
josei_03b[BUST]
<Teizoku> But I don’t even know what I want for
my own future.
<Mako> Do you want to get blacklisted from the sister
University?
<Teizoku> No.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Mako> So there we go, you don’t have to know exactly
what you want, you just gotta know what you don’t want.
josei_02a[BUST]
<Teizoku> But I also want to keep my photography
sacred to me.
<Mako> Hey Teizoku.
Mako grabbed onto Teizoku’s shoulders.
josei_02b[BUST]
<Mako> You can’t afford to do that in this situation
you know? My reputation and the school’s reputation
are both riding on the lines with you.
josei_03b[BUST]
<Mako> Think about the consequences if you don’t do
this. You will screw me, the school, and your own
future over.
<Mako> Maybe you don’t care so much about your own
future, but don’t you care about me? Aren’t I your
friend?
josei_02a[BUST]
<Teizoku> I understand, but it’s still a conflict.
josei_03e[BUST]
<Mako> Don’t think about it, Teizoku. Just believe me
when I say that it is correct, that’s all. The world
is complicated, sometimes you just have to do things.
josei_03d[BUST]
Teizoku looked away.
<Teizoku> Maybe...
josei_04a[BUST]
<Mako> Then good. Just take the picture and don’t
think about it too much, it’s best this way.
josei_01a[BUST]
<Mako> Now here, you should get going and take care of
whatever you were going to do. I also have things to
do now.
<Teizoku> ...
Teizoku left the room.
A
school sized
<Teizoku> Eh? Mako is sick today?
<Homeroom Teacher> Yeah, Mako’s mom called in that she
came down with a severe fever. She can’t leave her
house.
<Teizoku> Ah that’s not good.
<Homeroom Teacher> Yes, we wish her a speedy recovery.
<Teizoku> (Dammit!)
<Teizoku> Mrs. Tan, may I use the phone to call Mako’s
family? There is an emergency for the school project,
as you know I am in charge of and something urgent
just occurred that I must consult the president with.
<Homeroom Teacher> Students are not allowed to use the
phone, but we are currently on break and I know you
and Mako are trying your best for the sake of the
school.
<Homeroom Teacher> I will overlook it this time, but
you only have 10 minutes since my students will be
coming back soon.
<Teizoku> Thank you very much.
Teizoku dials Mako’s house number.
Mako’s mom picks up.
<Mako Mom> Hello! This is the Takenaka residence.
<Teizoku> Hello, Mako’s mom, this is Teizoku.
<Mako Mom> Teizoku-kun! How are you doing? It’s been a
while since you’ve been over. Mako was just talking
about you.
<Teizoku> I’m fine, thank you. Can you put Mako on the
line? I know that she’s sick but this is very urgent.
<Mako Mom> Mako-chan is currently in bed relaxing with
her fever, I’m sure she will feel happy and better
after talking to you! Please go ahead, I will put you
on the line with her now.
Mako’s mom brought the phone to her daughter.
<Mako> Tei-kun?
<Teizoku> Hi Mako, it’s me Teizoku.
<Mako> I’m sick with a fever! Why are you disturbing
the sick? But it was boring being here alone anyways,
so nevermind that. Whaddaya want?
Teizoku gulped and hesitated silently for a moment,
and tried to whisper the next few words to not let
the homeroom teacher hear him.
Before he spoke, things started crumbling inside of
Teizoku. The words he intended to say were not the
ones he ended up saying.
<Teizoku> I don’t think I can take the picture.
<Mako> What the fuck do you mean Teizoku??!!
<Teizoku> I don’t think I can take the picture of the
maid, with or without her consent. Can we negotiate
with the competition commission in some way?
<Teizoku> To let us represent our subjects in the
abstract, with shapes or colors or something else.
<Mako> Are you fucking kidding me right now? Stop
fucking around Teizoku!!
<Mako> Of course we can’t fucking take the picture in
the abstract ‘or something else’, the competition is
about real locations and the real people who reside in
the location!!
<Mako> Did you fucking fail to become her friend
and don’t have the balls to sneak a photo?
<Teizoku> No Mako, it’s not that. I am close with her.
If I ask her for a picture, she would accept.
<Mako> So what is the fucking problem??
<Teizoku> I thought that it would be better to
represent these things more artistically and
abstractly, realism is a bore you know?
<Mako> Hey. Cut the bullshit. You will be ruined,
absolutely ruined if you fail this. So will I, and the
whole school. Do you have any idea of the weight of
what you saying?
More things started shifting inside Teizoku.
<Teizoku> But Mako, isn’t this not even my burden?
Mako made some muffled sounds like if she stuffed and
stopped herself from screaming into the phone.
Mako’s tone was ice cold.
<Mako> What did you say, Teizoku-kun?
Teizoku’s anger smoldered.
<Teizoku> You put this on me, didn’t you? You were the
one who roped me into this competition against my will,
as well as roping me into that online competition.
<Teizoku> You also escalated this further by telling
the Principal to announce it to the whole school.
<Teizoku> You were the one to make my whole reputation,
academic integrity, and future stability dependent on
doing this one thing, that I didn’t even wanted to do,
but you did.
<Teizoku> It was all you Mako, you you you, never me.
<Teizoku> Even in the past, you always keep corralling
and pushing me into different things I didn’t want
without any consideration to how I feel, and now you’ve
pushed it further then ever,
<Teizoku> so how could I carry this burden on my
shoulder honestly? Why should I have to carry the
weight of the universe right here, when it was you
who picked it up and dropped it on my back?
Mako was silent for a minute.
Then Mako starting cackling in laughter on the other
end of the phone.
<Mako> Teizoku, you have no choice, you blame it all
on me? Aren’t you infinitely ungrateful for all the
things I’ve helped and done for you.
<Mako> It doesn’t matter, the consequence of your
failure will ripple across this whole school and into
your future, and you will be torn to shreds. You have
no choice, even if you say all of these things now.
<Mako> And you will still look back and thank me one
day. Why are you being so immature Teizoku? Don’t you
see how this benefits all of us? How much this would
progress your career?
<Mako> How many other students would die to have the
opportunities I’ve created for you?
<Mako> Why don’t you grow up, and stop being so petty
and picky about your sense of right and wrong, it’s
all malleable, open to interpretation.
<Mako> Isn’t it unethical to disappoint and fail all
of the people who depend on you succeeding this
competition? Why don’t you think about it that way?
<Teizoku> Because everything is dishonest here.
<Mako> Don’t you create more good for more people?
The world isn’t neat and tidy Tei-kun, some people
have to get hurt and sacrifices must be made for the
larger whole,
<Mako> this is a hard lesson to the hard fact about
life. It’s about efficiency, the usage of one for the
betterment of all. One photo for all of us.
<Teizoku> She didn’t put herself into this role and
neither did I.
<Mako> It doesn’t matter what she or you think or
want, what matters is what society demands and needs.
This world isn’t perfect.
<Mako> YOU will be the evil and unethical one here if
you place your own selfish sense of one maid’s sanctity
above the good of all of us Teizoku. Stop being
selfish, think about all of us involved.
Teizoku gritted his teeth.
<Teizoku> But you can say that to justify every evil
thing under the sun, as long as it is for the sake of
‘the greater good’. But that’s a lie and not true.
<Teizoku> You created these situation to suit your
gains at somebody else’s expense.
<Teizoku> You first sneakily tie your own interests to
the safety of the school, then you justify doing
whatever evil thing in the name of the school, but it
was always for the sake of your gain.
<Teizoku> So it was never about “for the the greater
good” when you were the one that created both the
problem and solution that victimizes someone else but
ultimately helps you out under the guise of community.
<Teizoku> So this is all a malicious lie. I see this
Mako, and I don’t agree with it.
<Mako> Tei-kun, when did you become so clever? Why
don’t you join us on the student council? We could
use more clever people like you.
<Teizoku> No Mako, I’m different than you.
<Mako> Are you really? Are you sure you are really
different than me or the Principal? It doesn’t matter.
<Mako> Have you even considered what your maid thinks
about this whole thing, she might not even care for
all that you know.
<Mako> Then you will fail and ruin everything about
you and and around you for a truly dusty and empty
ideal that isn’t even real inside the person you’re
putting it onto!
<Teizoku> ...
<Mako> And so what about what I’ve done? You think me
cruel but that’s not the case. I’ve done all of this
for all of us, it’s not wrong to try to improve our
standings in life.
<Mako> You are my friend Teizoku, why would I waste
all of my time and efforts on somebody I don’t care
about? All I do is just operate truly to how this
world functions, that is all.
<Mako> Well, you’ve seen it now, but no matter. Now
it’s time to make your choice, your dusty ideal or the
living good for everybody.
<Mako> Pick your sense of malleable sanctity and be
completely ostracized, marked, and ruined,
<Mako> or pick the more mature and realistic option
that guarantees your success and place in this world,
as well as helping all of us, as I’ve intended.
<Teizoku> ...
<Homeroom Teacher> Hey, Teizoku-kun?
<Teizoku> Yes?
<Homeroom Teacher> Your time is up, my students are
about to come in.
<Mako> Have fun Tei-kun. See you on this side very
soon.
Mako hung up the phone.
Teizoku stood unblinking and calcified, as the first
of the throng of students poured into the room.
Teizoku wordlessly left the table and room.
